db:abstract.db:para: A representation of a text selection within a PDF Document.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: PdfSelection provides the text string and its geometry within a bounding box from one point to another.

To modify the selection using the mouse, bind from and to to the suitable properties of an input handler so that they will be set to the positions where the drag gesture begins and ends, respectively; and bind the hold property so that it will be set to true during the drag gesture and false when the gesture ends.
PdfSelection also directly handles Input Method queries so that text selection handles can be used on platforms such as iOS. For this purpose, it must have keyboard focus.

db:section.db:title: document : PdfDocument
db:section.db:para: This property holds the PDF document in which to select text.

db:section.db:title: from : point
db:section.db:para: The beginning location, in pixels from the upper-left corner of the page, from which to find selected text. This can be bound to the centroid.pressPosition of a DragHandler to begin selecting text from the position where the user presses the mouse button and begins dragging, for example.

db:section.db:title: geometry : list<list<point>>
db:section.db:para: A set of paths in a form that can be bound to the paths property of a PathMultiline instance to render a batch of rectangles around the text regions that are included in the selection:

db:section.db:title: hold : bool
db:section.db:para: Controls whether to hold the existing selection regardless of changes to from and to. This property can be set to true when the mouse or touchpoint is released, so that the selection is not lost due to the point bindings changing.

db:section.db:title: page : int
db:section.db:para: The page number on which to search.

db:section.db:title: renderScale : real
db:section.db:para: The ratio from points to pixels at which the page is rendered.
This is used to scale from and to to find ranges of selected characters in the document, because positions within the document are always given in points.

db:section.db:title: to : point
db:section.db:para: The ending location, in pixels from the upper-left corner of the page, from which to find selected text. This can be bound to the centroid.position of a DragHandler to end selection of text at the position where the user is currently dragging the mouse, for example.

db:section.db:title: void copyToClipboard()
db:section.db:para: Copies plain text from the string property to the system clipboard.

db:section.db:title: void selectAll()
db:section.db:para: Selects all text on the current page.
